intro: Craepaloprumnon racemosum, commonly known as the racemose craspedia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a branching stem with opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are arranged in racemes, with yellow disk flowers surrounded by ray florets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
